text:
Research and Markets
DUBLIN , Oct. 05
Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/pr2zc4/global_connected ) has announced the addition of the "Global Connected Aircraft Market - Trends & Forecast, 2015-2020" report to their offering.
The global connected aircraft market is one of the fastest growing markets due to the growing demand of inflight internet by the air passengers. The connected aircraft entertainment systems provides entertainment to the air passengers in the form of games, music, movies, information, radio, and news. These entertainment systems provide one screen for each passenger with high quality audio and video programs. The passengers can directly access direct broadcast satellite, international news, flight information, live views of the landscape through binoculars and safety instructions in their own regional language.
The need for connected aircraft is increasing with the growing demand of air passengers especially from businessmen and millennial population. With the passage of time, the competition among the airlines has increased. They are trying to introduce new distinctive services to attract and retain the customers. Airlines are now moving towards the new connectivity technologies such as Ka band that are helping airlines to provide high speed inflight internet. Some of the major providers of in-flight entertainment market are Panasonic Avionics, Thales Group, Rockwell Collins, Gogo, Inmarsat, and global Eagle Entertainment.
The report provides an in-depth analysis of the global connected aircraft market along with drivers, restraints as well as growth opportunities and best practices in the market. It contains forecast revenues, competitive landscape, company profiles and industry trends.
